reviews.text: Really enjoyed my dinner. On a business trip and stopped in for a bowl. Food was great but I think everyone on the line doesn't know English.  I said brown rice 3 times and she scooped white rice. Everyone in line heard me and laughed at the situation. The guy ahead of me asked a question and the other lady making his bowl turned around and got help on translation.
Ordered via app to skip the long lines, probably should have waited in line, my to go salad bowl was barely half full. Was able to pickup my order 5 mins prior to ETA though.

I have never before felt compelled to write a review for a fast food place, but like many previous reviewers, today was the last straw for me with this location.

I placed an online order for pickup that included a chicken salad bowl, a burrito, and chips with salsa. While the food was ready on time, it was cold and the order was (once again) incorrect. The chicken "salad" had no lettuce at all and was mostly black beans. The chips came without the salsa that I ordered as well. I checked both the receipt on the bag and the sticker on the lid of the bowl, and both clearly read the order.

It seems like there is clearly an issue with the online ordering system here. Any time I've ordered in person, there have been no issues. However, it's extremely disappointing to never be able to get a reliable online order from here.

Complete waste of money and time. Got to Chipotle before 9pm, they said you can only do online orders. No problem at all, I ordered online and waited about 10 minutes. Got my food and went home. Then I get home to realize they gave me the complete wrong order with stuff I’m actually allergic to on it. So I drove back to the store to get them to make a new order. They did with no issues but while they’re making the new bowl one of the other workers is spraying cleaning products and wiping down the glass while reaching and leaning all over the food. That’s got to be some kind of health code violation I’m sure. Needless to say I should’ve just asked for a refund rather than having them remake the bowl. Will never come back here again. Terrible service! Wish I could give 0 stars.

Poor customer service! Been to this location many times and it seems to be going downhill. I came to pick up an online order and stood there waiting to be acknowledged and had to speak up and say I’m picking up an order.. And I received an unfriendly “if it’s here then grab it” response. There were no forks and my meal ended up being way too spicy. They are skimp with the portions or put on way too much hot sauce. I understand if busy or having a bad day… but it’s been this way the past few times going there. They need new management. Disappointed!

name: Subway
vicinity: 43490 Yukon Drive Suite 115, Bldg B, Ashburn

reviews.text: This is suppose to be double for everything, never seen such a small portion with subway before! They completely missed the whole receipt!  I won’t be coming back to this location again!
Their prices have increased by 50%. I remember when I could get a sub for $6. Now they start almost at $10.

They cancel online orders at any time of day despite making themselves available on all platforms, they are rude to customers and the slowest make line I’ve seen. The manager opens the store late and closes it early more often than not, and they skimp on pretty much all toppings for your sub. Only positive I can say is the place is at least clean when I’m forced to come order in person after my online order is cancelled. I’d recommend the subway on Broadlands Center Plaza to avoid the headache.

STOP AND READ THIS CAREFULLY
SKIP THIS SUBWAY and go to another location. I wish I could give them a black color star or no star. They are unpleasant, unapologetic and won't even accept to take care of the bad order experience. Rather argumentative.
I got my order confirmation in the email and I went to pick it and they said we don't have your order. My CC is reflecting the charge already and I went to another location to buy then to deal with them. Horrible Horrible Horrible. This location is 🤮
DON'T GO VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.!!!!!🤮
Staff wasn't friendly at all. The food was OK, though.

Ordered a high protein meal from this location via door dash. I don’t get to eat out often so when I do . My expectations aren’t high.

The banana was completely rotten. 100% inedible and the more insulting part is some deliberately put that banana in the bag.

The wrap did have the extra chicken I requested. Which I’m assuming is why it was ripped almost in half. That , or they just didn’t care, which is already evident given the banana.

Then that brings me to the protein smoothie. Which frankly I just don’t trust given the other two items I received.

TL:DR
Worse tropical Iv ever visited.

What is this.

EDIT: after their comment. We ordered three smoothies, only got one. This "quesadilla" was missing most of the ingredients. The smoothie we did get was wrong. We requested a refund and was told they were not able to do it, because they didn't know how. This is not the first time, but the second time at this location. I recommend retraining or changing the staff.

The food and smoothies have turned out good for me so far, but the service is so slow  compared to other locations.  Please improve your service speed and quality.  I usually don't leave reviews, but had plenty of time to burn while waiting for my food to think and write about this.  Me and the guy in front of me are still waiting....

My friend, Gene, came up from Lorton (south of Burke/Fairfax) and we arrived at a semi-busy time.  He ordered a chicken wrap and he told me it was delicious.  I had a hummus wrap and loved it.  I had it before.  We shared a green detox drink.  So, all in all, we were quite happy!  A comment on the help behind the counter. The person taking our money was pleasant.  When I said to give me an extra cup so I could share the drink with my friend, she said she would just divide the drink for me.   Half a drink is enough for me and was for my friend!  I would have never thought to eat at a Tropical Smoothie.  My son and his wife brought me home twice the hummus wrap.  So, I would try it if you haven't ever.  Hopefully you will be pleasantly surprised as I was.
Not a great tropical smoothie location staff aren't professional or experienced my name was spelled wrong and my wrap wasn't put together well.

name: Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews

reviews.text:
This is the first time I've been here again in quite a while. Sorry this is so long.
My mother was sat first, we joined after a few minutes and waited more than 10 minutes, and still no one had come to our table. I ended up having to go to the host to ask for a server. I don't understand how this happens when there are only 5 tables seated in a restaurant.
Our server Derek was lovely in general, he was very friendly and funny and he is the only reason there is even a star there.
I did find it strange that when I ordered a salad with "my choice of dressing" they don't offer Caesar dressing? But I guess that's not something they can control.  I just find it strange.
So I receive my salad with a knife in it (??), and I ask our waiter for a fork and he brings me "to go" plastic cutlery and says they're out of forks. How does a restaurant run out of forks?
Besides that, the salad tasted off, but that could be me and maybe not the dressing/lettuce.
We ordered pizza for my son and they put the side of fries on top of the pizza leaving them full of sauce and soggy and I have to assume that whomever did that, doesn't have children.
We tried to order the fish and chips to go for my dad but apparently they were out of that as well.
Overall, no one really enjoyed their food but the beer, Shirley temples, and the spiked lemonade were pretty good.
Like I said, it's been a while since I've been here but I don't think I'll ever be back.

Red Robin have grown as a chain that can now target a wide range of customers. From children to youth to middle-aged, they've got some good item on the menu for everyone now. Would recommend you to try their cocktails on the sides.

Tried one of RR's new personal pizzas. I was curious about the cauliflower crust... feeling adventurous, I ordered it with tomatoes, green peppers and ground beef. I was surprised at how crispy the crust was...even in the middle of the pizza where pizzas are often oily. It wasn't a gourmet pizza and not a lot of flavor but it was served hot and it was good. I'd order it again. I do think the chef put sausage on it rather than beef and my husband's fries were cold...so 4 stars.
Great service. Food came out fresh and hot! Derek was my server the past 2 times I’ve been and he took care of me well. We just need some gf dessert options!

I love Red Robin. My family and I are frequent flyers of this restaurant chain. I have to say this is the worst Red Robin I have been to and needs a change. Came here at lunch time on a Sunday. The place was dead. I would like to point out the servers were great and we had no problems there. Bathrooms were filthy. When our food came out the buns were stale, the burger itself was concerning, old tasting dry and gritty and appeared to have sat out for a long time by the texture. I actually had one bite and didn’t finish it because I was worried that I would get food poisoning. Buns were hard they were so stale, but toasted as an attempt to cover. I love Red Robin but will not be back to this location as it needs a major over haul.

I went there with my friends and had wonderful Taiwanese food and customer service! I had Jasmine Tea, A-thai with Garlic, Pipa Tofu and Minced Pork & String Bean with Black bean with buns. They are all very tasty and fresh. The taste here is not too salty nor oily. I dont like heavy greasy Chinese with too much sugar. They were all mild and fine taste. I will come back and try more food here! Thank you for the great customer service too!

Came out from DC for Yen’s Cafe, and wow are we glad we made the trip. An absolute destination-worthy dinner! We split the potstickers, Mongolian beef, 3-cup chicken, and Yen’s Special rice. All dishes were made with great care (they even make their own crunchy noodles — who does that! — a nice touch), beautifully seasoned and flavorful, and with remarkably fresh ingredients. Each was a showstopper. Every member of our party had a different favorite, showing the versatility at play here. A pot of the rose tea also proved a nice accompaniment. Do yourself a favor and get out to Yen’s — absolutely delicious food at fair prices with nice ambience and friendly staff — a win on all fronts.

The food here is delicious and authentic. The crispy beef is simply amazing. They will cater to whatever level of spiciness you desire. Carryout can be slow around dinner time, but the wait is worth it! Your patience will be rewarded!

Food is very authentic and tasty. We dined in. Was really glad friends picked this place. The Taiwanese fried chicken is juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The owner was really nice and friendly. Service was great too. Will come back!

Where to start? Amazing top to bottom. I couldn't wait to come back after the first bite. This quiet little spot is comfortable, with friendly folks and a beautiful atmosphere. Everything tasted phenomenal. The tea presentation was superb. They have a tea menu with 10 different flavorful teas. The folks kept refilling the pot too! I started with the hot and sour soup which was the drop down best!!
I had the beef with snow pea tips in Sha chat sauce which was clean, not middled sauce and a perfectly cooked dish. The moo shoo chicken was the best I've seen. The bamboo tray of steamed wraps was a great addition. I can't wait to try more things next time!!

We order here a few times a month and it’s always on point. Even though there are tables there this place is meant for take out, only dine in if you need a quick bite to eat. Also highly recommend their crispy chicken. Best item on the menu hands down.

Great place for takeout or delivery! Food is great with a lot of options!
And customer service is spot on!

For the person who put a 1 star review for this place. Shame on you!

Below average based on 3 lunch specials I tried.  Broccoli beef was a bit over cooked and 2 other dishes (twice cooked pork and kung pao chicken) were so-so.  The spring rolls were crispy but too salty for my taste)

Service was not very friendly. Atmosphere was stale and the food was edible but lacked flavor. They handle food without gloves. They have coupons on there website, so I mention I wanted to redeem on on my order since I met the total requirement to do so. The lady said I could not redeem the coupon because my pretax total was a dollar and some change short of the $35 minimum.
This is our go to delivery place. They are great about customizing our entrees per special request.

We always loved the bagels and the breakfast sandwiches at Panera. If you are planning to get breakfast here, I would recommended placing either curbside or the pickup order. I walked in and placed the order and waited over 20 minutes for the pickup. No concerns with the food.

I had ordered a pizza with no garlic cream sauce and sub it with tomato sauce but didn’t see any tomato sauce when checking, I spoke to the employee; probably a manager b/c he was wearing a collared shirt and when I had showed him, he looked at it and said “there is but it’s all in the middle” so I believed him but when I went home to eat it you can taste there wasn’t at all. I also had ordered a turkey sandwich with mayonnaise added to it and they didn’t put any as you can see in the photo
I've been coming to this location for three years now and I can see it down and down unfortunately. Cofee was cold and what you see is my breakfast this morning!
Chicken salad is just a salad with a small piece of chicken stuck between think as bread.  Panera the place where good food and ideas goes to die

The food, being a chain, is as expected.  Lately, though, I have been having a series of issues at this location when ordering to-go: either something is missing, or it's the wrong item, or it takes way too long.  I suggest always checking your order: they will quickly address any issues

i didn’t get the name of the man i spoke with, but the order i received was wrong. he told me to call later for a credit. i asked, why would i need to call later (having been on hold for 10 minutes) and he scuffed and said he could credit me for the order. i said you can re-deliver the correct or or issue me a refund. he was short and rude. i get it, it’s a chain. i worked a chain for 5 years too long but you should have the decency to approach customer complaints with a measure of care. here’s to hoping i actually get me refund. based on the recording i listened to for the extended period of time, the owner of this location is a local resident. so if you take mind to reviews, please remind your managers of proper procedure for handling customer complaints.
Was goood . Very quick delivery. Hit the spot

I was picking up a DoorDash order and the young man working there offered me a few slices of thin crust cheese and I forgot to thank him. So, thank you very much for blessing me with some pizza. #FiveStars

We moved into Ashburn back when farms were everywhere...   Money was tight and of course our kids loved Pizza, like most. It was another way to get them to devote themselves, 'They Earned It!'

PaPa Johns is tastieeeee, nothing special, but of course the kids liked it as I did at Pistone's back in the day. When the "Colonel" a supposed franchise ower in this entire area started jackin' prices up big time, I started cutting down on his PP John's version.
There Adverts, the purposely keeping you on hold when ordering over the phone, merely another way to Psych You Out, PP John's,  PP John's...

I go to Ceasars Dom now. I still live in the $$$ Ashburn, the richest County....  but what the heck. When I have grand kids, they'll go to college, they'll need spoiling toooo.

Of Course, That Is My Opinion ¿?

Peace!

The pizza was kind of dry, and it was kind of a waste of money. It wasn't very tasty, but that was a one time thing. Most of the time, the pizza is really good, and we enjoy it. But that day wasn't super good because we had friends over and they despised the pizza and asked for something else...

During my recent visit to this McDonald's location, I couldn't help but notice how difficult it was to order a shake. Apparently, the shake machine is often out of order, making it almost impossible to get one on a daily basis. On one occasion, an employee recommended that I try a smoothie instead, but when I placed my order, they changed their mind and said that a shake was available instead. It was a strange experience, to say the least.

Although the staff wasn't unfriendly, I didn't find them particularly welcoming either. They seemed to be going through the motions without making an effort to connect with customers. I was a bit disappointed since good customer service can make all the difference in the dining experience.

To add to my frustration, my order was often missing sauces that I had requested. This meant that I had to go back to the counter or drive-thru window to ask for them separately.

Overall, while I enjoy McDonald's food, my experience at this location was average at best. The food was decent, but the service and availability of certain items could have been better. I may consider returning, but it wouldn't be my first choice for a quick meal.

Strawberry smoothie tastes good.  My beef is they didn't fill it to the top, but now after reading all the reviews I'm afraid to finish it.  Probably will because i already paid for it, but  I'm lookin at it differently now.  I probably won't b back

Can't complain much about McDonald's, it's a certified classic and the meals we have here are always a bargain for the taste and cost. I do have to dock a star for timeliness, the most recent curbside pickups have taken a bit more time than it should have. Cars that got drive thru after we arrived for our curbside order got their food first, which doesn't seem right. A more consistent curbside experience would make this location exceptional.

I admit it: I've got a guilty pleasure and it goes by the name of McDonald's. I love, periodically (keep your health and diet in mind, people), getting a fresh, hot order of a quarter pounder with cheese, fresh fries, maybe a splurge on 3-for-a-$1 cookies here, an upcharge for a vanilla milkshake there... from a great McDonald's location.

Now, admittedly, a good fast food experience sometimes depends on the location of the restaurant. Some of my more shameful experiences of McD's meals have, unfortunately, come from poorer areas where everything from customer service to excessive greasiness of the burgers were unjustly exchanged for a few of my dollars and a surcharge of my patience.

This particular McDonald's location, however, has consistently surprised me with a very close 1:1 ratio of "ideal" McDonald's quality (the kind of food you see in advertisements) with what you actually experience when you open the bag and eat. It's not always a picturesque match in visual presentation (the burger buns or patties are sometimes lop-sided) but, this location always seems to get heat and grease levels perfect which, in my omnivorous opinion, is more important.

The burgers here have never been overly greasy, the fries have been just the right level of crispiness, and the sodas and milkshakes have been at the higher end of McDonald's quality (as far as guilty pleasures go in quality, that is). Quality of food here comes highly recommended, so long as you eat your meal as soon after you order it as possible.

In terms of the cleanliness of this location, I've only experienced it as a closed-for-dining/drive-thru only location. Every time I've pulled the door handle, it's been locked (COVID times being what they are). That said, the drive-thru is relatively quick, the orders have been accurate, and the meals delicious.

Lastly, as an awesome money-saving bonus tip, I'd recommend downloading the app for regular coupons or deals for free food or skipping drive-thru lines. Or, if you don't want to do that but enjoy free quarter pounders with cheese (like I do), I encourage you to save your McD's receipts and fill out the quick online surveys to get the promo codes for a B1G1 deal on your next visit!

Like I said, McDonald's is a guilty pleasure for me and this location has been great with drive-thru customer service and food quality. I'd recommend this location over others in the area. Eat fast food responsibly and in moderation (I know, I know, I've got two burgers pictured)! Bring coupons and deals for savings and extras! Enjoy :)
Horrible. Service is just hilarious, they don't care about customers,  orders, food, cleanliness or anything. Flies inside of the deserts as part of the menu? Ridiculous.

Blackfin is ... not too bad, not extraordinary. It's overpriced in my opinion. The menu has its takes on the general stuff you'll find at most bars/pubs in the US. It doesn't try to be very original, but it doesn't fail at meeting your basic expectations of a place to have absent-mindedly overpay for a drink or appetizer while hanging out with friends or watching some sport.

Unfortunately we did not have the best experience. Our waiter was great, but our kids meal burger and my eggs where raw. We did not ask for a refund, so I can not comment if they would or not. Our other child’s meal and my husband meal were good, but not sure if we’d risk going back again.

Food was amazing! I really enjoyed my sangria too! Our food came out pretty fast. Our waitress was a little slow which we didn’t mind because we were enjoying ourselves, but we did need water refills and my friend always had to call her down for her soda refill too. And we were the only ones there! That’s why I took off one star. Will def be back though!! Also, cannot beat happy hour. Make sure to check when that is!!!
Awesome food. Awesome service. Our server Victor was the best. Thank u for a great evening and fantastic food. Will see u soon!!

The service was excellent, the food was sort of ok. The nachos were great. The fried deviled eggs were horrible. Even removing the breading was not good enough, still tasted horrible. I normally love deviled eggs. My friend said the lemonade didn’t taste good. The fries looked good and my friend said they were good. My Mac and cheese with pulled pork started out good but tasted a little strange but it might have been that I didn’t like the type of smoking of the pork. The sweet tea was good.
Thai shrimp burger and Santa Fe salad are our favorites. Kids loved buffalo chicken and barbecue bacon burgers. Definitely our favorite burger place.

Juicy burger joint sequestered in the heart of Loudoun Station. Buttressed by Blackfinn Pub and Famous Toastery, a solid go-to movie theater right around the corner, and the brand spanking new metro station in Ashburn within walking distance.

I came around noon, debating on brunch at FT or a quick-and-easy lunch at B-21, my fave local spot to grab a burger at. I decided to cast caution to the wind, and play shotgun roulette with B-21.

I swung by here, and was presented with a near-deserted ambiance and a non-existent line. This place sorely needs more patrons, if you ask me.

I rolled the 20-sided dice yet again, and went with the Steakhouse Black Pepper (#71) -- a limited time burger, and a likewise signature shake to go hand-in-hand with it -- the Triple Shot Espresso.

At the end, I was presented with one of those fancy flag things that flagrantly flew my order number -- #69. Right on, brotha. I would've preferred a digit higher though -- almost hitting the nail on the head, my fave number knocking right next door.

Wait was not bad. I chose one of those fancy, four-seater booths adjoining the window.

Milkshake arrived first, with presentation on top-tier level. Black, chocolate-coated espresso beans with what looked like cinnamon sprinkled atop it. I had a few sips, and it truly hit the spot, on what felt like the warmest day in the cold, biting heart of Virginia winter.

The burger arrived later, shadowing the footsteps of the shake. Luxurious angus beef patty, Swiss cheese riddled with miniature holes that would even make a mouse proud, smoked bacon that skirted the edge of grandeur, and a brioche bun that provided the fitted icing on a medium-rare and well-seasoned cake.

While I ate and drank my milkshake in the warm and languorous peace, I thought about my experiences, life choices, and a little of everything. I appreciate the peace that the atmosphere offered me, on a deep and altogether personal level.

Burger, pretty solid and a home run in terms of presentation alone. Milkshake, never tried but a signature and unforgettable flavor.

All in all, solid experience at B-21. Burgers here are reasonably priced, and have never let me down so far.
Stopped here midway through a hike to the new Ashburn Metro.  Was impressed with my tasty burger.  Fries were perfect too.  I washed down my burger with a delicious cream soda.  Yum.

I had hamburger medium well done.  It was too dry.  My kids had medium rare which were better.

I have to give another try for better review.
Everything was great! Burgers were juicy and delicious. Service was great. Thanx Matt for a great experience. Will be back
Burgers ate made fresh from groundbeef. Great dining atmosphere. Food is expensive and a little greasy but it definitely hits the spot.

Super expensive, like five guys but not as good and smaller portions. Like extremely small.  Over 6 dollars for these fried pickles. Really disappointed. Tates alright. I don't regret eating here. Its alright to check out but thats about it.
Probably the worst burgers besides Red Robin.  Meat is flavorless and so thin the buns are not fresh and dense. They were cold straight out of the fridge.  Fries were the best part

So delicious BLT grilled chicken sandwich, juicy cheesy burger cooked just right, oooo and cheesy bacon fries. Wonderful clean atmosphere. Hospitality and service was great. I highly recommend Wayback Burgers. Price was fair service was fast. Food was so fresh off the grill, delicious and hot.

I was looking forward to trying the burgers from here, as I've driven by it so many times.

I was able to order my burger with ease. However, she asked if I wanted a combo, so I said sure, could I get onion rings, are they included? Yes, then she asked me what soda I wanted, so I asked if I get a bottle of water, is it extra? No. Apparently a "combo" is not like a fast food combo that is pre-priced; instead, you pay the the actual price for the drink and fries/onion rings. So NO it's not included and is extra.

I ordered a cheeseburger with grilled onions, mushrooms, swiss cheese and mayo/ketchup. I was waiting by the counter, so I watched them make the food. I'm not sure if she was being stingy with the onions/mushrooms butI had to ask her to put more of the grilled onions/mushrooms on my burger. The meat patty was pretty dry and there really wasn't enough of the onions and mushrooms.

The onion rings were amazing, and the mac & cheese bites were pretty good too, but not very cheesy. They are very clean though, I noticed that they were always handling the food with gloves. At one point, I saw the girl change her gloves, so that's part of the reason for the two stars, otherwise, I'd have given one.

I came here for the burger/onion rings on my first visit and came back another day for the mac & cheese bites.

I can't say that I would definitely return... There are way too many other burger places to try out and this area.

I knew that some 7-11s in Texas had these thanks to a Mikey Chen YouTube video, so I was pleasantly surprised to find this one in VA. The flour tortillas are hand-rolled right in front of you, which definitely sets the tacos here apart from other gas station food. I had a shrimp fajita taco and a chicken fajita taco, and they definitely were a step above typical gas station food. Would drive out here just for that.

Was spending the night in Ashburn, VA and the hotel check-in said they were pretty good. Thought I would give a try. I ordered the ground beef, pork carnitas, beef fajita tacos. All 3 were very, very salty. Out of the 3, the beef fajita taco was the best. When I ordered and brought them back to my room (less than 5 min) tacos were cold.
Delicious! I loved the tortillas for the tacos. Some of the best I've ever had.

literally gas station food. I drove by it several times before i realized it's inside the gas station convenience store. so no tables or service, leaving just the food to speak for itself. i am torn on which standard i should use to rate them. they a advertise as a restaurant, so i rate them as such. as a convenience store, the rating would have 2 more stars. i had a bean and cheese taco. the tortilla was good, the cheese was a decent quality Jack, and that was about it for the high points. i added potatoes, and they tasted ok, but had been in the warmer too long and were rubbery. the true low point was the beans. you can't convince me that they weren't straight out of a can.

Yes it's gas station food but this was awful. Got a quesadilla. Tortilla had a good crunchy texture but the taste was not good. Way too much cheese. Just a big glob of tasteless gooey nothing. I only got a few bites in before gagging. They didn't even bother to cut my quesadilla!

I'll avoid this place next time.
Great service. Fresh coffee and loaf. Clean bathrooms. Enough parking. Drive through available.

Service is terribly slow.  We had 1 person in front of us.  Our bread and pastries took 12 minutes to get and our drinks took over 15.  The baristas didn't seem to notice or care and just seemed to enjoy talking about their friends.  Pretty disappointing.   The service used to be so much better.

The manager does an amazingly poor job of running this place. Waited over 20 minutes for 2 cups of brewed coffee even though there are 6 people working. 2 orders under my name placed in the app 1/21/23 at 1038 am.

They only prioritize the drive-thru, there were less than 5 customers in the store. I finally had it when they had to brew another pot of blonde roast for me and then kept filling cups as it as it was brewing to give to the drive-thru customers. I asked the manager about it and she said there are two lines. Couldn't care less that I was there over 20 min and getting passed repeatedly. Left without getting anything that I had already used my app for. Save yourself the aggravation and go anywhere else.
I ordered a Is caramel macchiato iced and my husband ordered the same only hot. Mine wasn't the best, they put whip on his and he asked for kids temp but it was extremely hot.
One of the best Starbucks around neighborhood.  Very kind staff, and cozy place.  Love this place.

If you have time to “burn” go to this Taco Bell”. Busy or not people there just take their time. When you ask for sauce, first they’ll give you two or three. I really had to ask couple of times to get what I wanted. Well, it’s a fast food chain restaurant, these kind of things are expected.

Good for late night grub. Food is typically hot & fresh. I had a couple of mix ups with my order in the 8 or 9 months I've been eating here & they were willing to remake the order.

So far, so good 👍

I always have a great experience here. Food is always hot, made correctly, and the staff are pleasant to talk to. Super fast service at the drive-thru most of the time (there are sometimes long lines late at night but it’s for good reason).

My wife and I stopped by with friends to this location and the final meals (mine was Dorito gordita crunch) were objectively amazing.  The real deal. Reminds me why Taco Bell is worth the extra calories.

i come here on the regular and haven’t had a bad experience. just make sure you have all your items before you leave the drive through. just like you should in all drive thrus.
10/10

The food here is tasty. I like how the steak is very juicy along with cheese and other veggies. Having churros at the end is a perfect conclusion to my lunch. This restaurant has great vibe and colorful decorations which makes me feel like I’m attending festivals. Besides, the staff is very nice and welcoming. Will definitely come back again!

My boyfriend and I passed by the restaurant in the morning and decided to give it a try for dinner!

The service was great. And the food was amazing.

I ordered the skinny margarita, corn, and the other plate which is served in a hot stone bowl.

The food tasted so good and authentic!

I originally didn't plan to come to this restaurant until I found it while parking. The service was great. I have eaten Mexican food on a regular basis and I will say this is very authentic. The horchata is spot on and not watered down despite it being $4; And the chips are served fresh.
When I got my order (Poblanas), I was expecting the mole on top of the enchiladas to be spicy. Sadly it wasn't. However, it doesn't take away how great my meal was. I definitely recommend this place to folks on business trips looking for Hispanic food. The taste is close to street food without the annoying fly buzzing around.

The food is always good here; my favorite items are the jambalaya burrito & the grilled  Chimichangas. The table side quac is always perfect 😍 the staff is always nice & helpful. The drinks are good. My favorite place in the area.

Visited senor tequila's for the first time for a casual lunch. The restaurant is a well decorated quaint, and modern set up. While service was unsatisfactory even during a week day lunch with below average traffic, the food was good.

Tried the chicken jambalaya which was high on flavor and good textures. The diablo sauce is a hit.

This was our first time in the restaurant. We have always heard good things but never made the attempt to go. Our mistake. From great customer service to great food, this place is a no brainer for another visit.

The corn bread is as soft and sweet as cake. And the house made apple butter on the corn bread hits the spot. You taste the cinnamon first with a tangy apple after taste.

I had the eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes. The poached eggs were cooked just right and potatoes were full of flavor without being greasy.

They have a full selection of drinks of all kinds. We started with flight of mimosas. My favorites were the Passion Fruit and Berry. My daughter's favorite was the traditional Orange juice. Speaking OJ, the juice is freshly made there. We ended up getting one to go and there is nothing better than freshly squeezed orange juice.

Positives: Clean and modern vibe. Waitress was attentive and kind. The food was warm, great quality, and seasoned well. The drinks were fruity, eggs were cooked perfectly, and the portions were generous.

Negatives: None that I can recall!

Overall taste: 9.5/10

Five stars. Almost perfect!

The place was very busy, the wait was quick a few minutes as they warn you. The service and the food will leave you satisfied. A good place to meet in the morning with the whole family or someone special or alone.  highly recommend.
We’ve been here a couple of times and both times it’s been great. One of the best brunch in Loudoun county. Waffles, omelettes, freshly squeezed orange juice, really delicious!
Stopped for brunch on our way through VA. LOVED the Mimosa flight and Ultimate Bloody Mary. Kids chocolate milk was very chocolatey! Crepes were delicious, but only served on weekends.

name: bb.q Chicken Ashburn
vicinity: 43801 Central Station Drive Suite B150, Ashburn

reviews.text: First time trying, was craving for fried chicken (Korean style). Chicken (boneless) was well seasoned/ marinated. Wings was delicious. Cheese fries is not for me, I'm sure other people likes it. Place is no frills, service was adequate and the chicken hits the spot. Breading just enough and not masking the chicken and the sauce is just enough ( not swimming in it). I saw a lot of people picking up and ordering to go. Good food experience over all.

Can’t go here anymore. Too many mistakes. Ordered from here today. Got half fried and half secret sauce. I guess the sauce was too secret cause they barely put it on the chicken. Usually when I get it there’s so much sauce that I can use it for the regular fried chicken. It looks like they brushed it on the chicken or something. Like are times so bad that you have to scrimp on the sauce?

I called in and told them that the chicken was barely covered in sauce. Told me they couldn’t do anything aside from giving me more sauce. Because if they tried to do anything else, the manager will yell at them.

If you have to. ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO get chicken from here, CHECK YOUR ORDER before you leave. It’s really sad when the customer has to check their order before leaving the store. Really speaks the quality control of the restaurant. Like if McDonald’s messes up your order, you understand cause well… it’s McDonald’s. But here? C’mon. This was the last time. Can’t eat here again. Too many mistakes.

I ordered spicy galbi wings and small order of honey garlic wings here today .
It's good and I love BBQ chicken.
But today was not good..
We found a hair on the honey garlic wings. Even it should not happen,
It's ok .. just hair.. I am also working at the restaurant so I understand.
But I couldnt accept that I found a piece of iron scrubber on the spicy galbi wings... as u can see the picture.
I got so disappointed here today .

Amazing chicken and great spicy chicken sandwich perhaps best Halal spicy chicken sandwich in the DMV. The (whole chicken) wings with the secret sauce just melt in your mouth. Great atmosphere and everything except the bone in wings is Halal.
Excellent chicken and service! Tried the wings of fire and the spicy galbi flavors and both were excellent. Can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
The pork spring rolls were amazing!!!!! The boba tea’s were incredible. Be sure to try all of them! 4 Sisters rocks👍👍👍👍👍
Excellent vegetarian/vegan options. The banh mi with tofu was super tasty and fresh. Veg dumplings were hot and crispy.

I love 4 sisters! Just went an hour ago and ordered 5 bobas, they were done in less than 5 minutes. Employees are super sweet and efficient. Very kind people and inside is very clean/well kept. Of course the boba here is great, their tapioca texture is just right. I recommend the matcha brown sugar. This place is a staple!!
Really good boba it's not chewy and the tea is sooooooo good

Delicious snacks and drinks in a friendly, fun atmosphere. High quality and inventiveness you can expect from the 4 Sisters family. Convenient hours, ample parking. Bring your longing for the Falls Church Eden Center's beloved Song Que out to Ashburn. We love the bahn mi, crispy spring rolls, and bubble drinks--looking forward to trying everything else!

Location is great. The food is decent. Service is OK. I ordered the triple delight. I didn't try the Hibachi grills. I tried the other side maybe, next time. Will come again to try again. The ambiance is great. The place needs a good renovation.

Had a great time at the restaurant. The choices and the service were also good.
Here are couple of things that caused the rattling to be lower than a 5:
Our reservation time was 7.30 pm but we were not seated until around 8.10 pm
One of the items wasn’t brought even though it very clearly requested.

This place was delicious!! I only rated it 4 because of the performance but other than that the food was surprisingly delicious👌. The fried rice was perfectly cooked, the vegetables weren't overly cooked or soggy, the noodles were just right and a nice add on. All of the protein was cooked evenly- 🥩Steak, 🦞Lobster, 🦐Shrimp, 🍗Chicken all great. The miso soup was lukewarm but very tasty. The salad was nice, light and flavorful. The staff was very humourous and adapting to our needs. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely come here from now on for Hibachi👍

Originally from NJ and we’ve struggled to find a quality hibachi  location. That was until tonight! Tonight’s dinner left me full and very satisfied. And we were celebrating a late birthday/ Valentine’s Day because of work which they made extremely special!

Everyone was attentive, polite, and very welcoming. Service was quick and the hibachi chef had us beyond entertained. Sakura has become our new go to place and we’ve already begun planning date nights with friends to this location.

Thank you for making our delayed celebrations so very special for us tonight.

A really nice place for some “YUMMY YUMMY” hibachi! Our server was the best! His go to saying is “yummy yummy”. He made us laugh and giggle as he was cooking the hibachi, which we thought was funny/nice of him.
Definitely check them out for yourselves, you won’t regret it.
